channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After False Earthquake Alert in Nevada, Lawmakers Demand Answers on How it Was Sent
item.description: The federal government and earthquake experts blamed a technical glitch for the alert that sent warnings hundreds of miles away last week.

item.title: Venezuela Oil Tanker Seized by U.S. Was Part of Effort to Finance Cuba
item.description: Firms with ties to Cuba are getting a larger share of Venezuelan oil exports, as the island’s security agents boost President Nicolás Maduro’s defense...

item.title: Trump names Warsh, Hassett as top Fed contenders, WSJ says
item.description: “I think the two Kevins are great,” he said. “I think there are a couple of other people that are great.”

item.title: Dozens Killed as a Hospital Is Bombed in Myanmar’s Brutal Civil War
item.description: Jets from the Myanmar military dropped two bombs on the facility in Mrauk-U, in what rebels and witnesses called a deliberate attack on civilians.

item.title: The CEO of one of Asia’s largest co-working space providers says his business has more in common with hotels
item.description: “It's a hospitality business," JustCo CEO Kong Wan Sin tells Fortune.

item.title: Amid Fractures on the Right, Tucker Carlson Continues His Attacks
item.description: On Theo Von’s show this week, Mr. Carlson lashed out at a major supporter of the president, the F.B.I. and “unimpressive, dumb, totally noncreative pe...

item.title: Judge’s Order Complicates Justice Dept. Plans to Again Charge Comey
item.description: Justice Department officials have been considering whether to bring new charges against James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, after a different ...

item.title: Behind the Venezuelan Opposition Leader’s Daring Escape to Oslo
item.description: An American firm with experience in special operations spirited María Corina Machado, the recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize, out of the country in a ...

item.title: Venezuela Oil Tanker Seized by U.S. Was Part of Effort to Finance Cuba
item.description: Firms with ties to Cuba are getting a larger share of Venezuelan oil exports, as the island’s security agents boost President Nicolás Maduro’s defense...

item.title: Russia Sues Holder of Frozen Assets Europe Wants for Ukraine Loan
item.description: The lawsuit was a warning to European officials who are racing to agree to a plan to use Russian government assets in Europe to lend money to Ukraine.

item.title: Dozens Killed as a Hospital Is Bombed in Myanmar’s Brutal Civil War
item.description: Jets from the Myanmar military dropped two bombs on the facility in Mrauk-U, in what rebels and witnesses called a deliberate attack on civilians.

item.title: In a Hamlet Built on Forbidden Love, a Cyclone Buried It All
item.description: Three generations of a family built their homes and lives in Sri Lanka’s highland tea country. The biggest storm in decades wiped out their hamlet in ...

item.title: The Fed just ‘Trump-proofed’ itself with a unanimous move to preempt a potential leadership shake-up
item.description: “If I’m reading this properly, they just Trump-proofed the Fed.”

item.title: Trump says ‘starting’ land strikes over drugs in latest warning
item.description: “We knocked out 96% of the drugs coming in by water, and now we’re starting by land, and by land is a lot easier, and that’s going to start happening....

item.title: ‘The question is really just how long it will take’: Over 2,000 gather at Humanoids Summit to meet the robots who may take their jobs someday
item.description: Researchers at McKinsey have counted about 50 companies that have raised at least $100 million to develop humanoids.
